title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 05
author: Various
snippet: It was in vain that Mr. Micklewhame protested he had never been inQueensferry in his life; nor had he the honour of the acquaintance ofGrog, the innkeeper; but, at length, seeing that it was impossible toconvince the officers to the contrary he thought it advisable to paythe amount of their demand, and trust to law and justice afterwards forretribution.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 05
author: Various
snippet: "We've pursued you from Queensferry," said the first--"round byEdinburgh, Glasgow, and Stirling; and Grog the innkeeper is determinedto punish you, unless you pay him for the eight weeks' board you had inhis house, and our expenses over and above."

title: James Nasmyth, Engineer: An Autobiography
author: Nasmyth, James
snippet: We started from Newhaven by a small steamboat,passing, on our way up the Firth, Queensferry, Culross, and Alloa.

title: The X jewel,
author: Moncreiff, Fred. Chas.
snippet: He had been hurried, along with his horse, probably under cloud of night, across the water at the Queensferry,  and before the sun rose again he was within  the walls of Fastcastle.

title: The X jewel,
author: Moncreiff, Fred. Chas.
snippet: He was riding home from the Queensferry when he had word that the passes through the hills were beset for him.

title: The X jewel,
author: Moncreiff, Fred. Chas.
snippet: You need not attempt to go by Stirling,  for my good brother James has closed the Brig. The Queensferry is a little too near to Kinneil for you ; and, besides, on account of the Plague, the ferry-boats are everywhere forbidden to cross, except those plying between Leith and Kingorn."

title: Two gray tourists: from papers of Mr. Philemon Perch
author: Johnston, Richard Malcolm
snippet: And so Queen Mary used to come out this way and spend some of her time at Linlithgow, crossing the Almond Vale, Queensferry and on by Barnbough Castle.

title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: On Monday Dr. Chalmers posted from Kirkaldy to Queensferry, got an outside seat on the Edinburgh mail, arrived in Glasgow between five and six o'clock on Tuesday morning, and on Wednesday forenoon  preached one of his most brilliant discourses, composed during the intervals, and after the exhaustion of this rapid and fatiguing journey.

title: Memoirs of the life and writings of Thomas Chalmers...
author: Hanna, William
snippet: I got to Queensferry before five.

title: Memorials of his time,
author: Cockburn, Henry Cockburn
snippet: Hence Newington, Leith Walk, the grounds of Inverleith, the road to Corstorphine, and to Queensferry, and indeed all the modern approaches, which lead in every direction through most comfortable suburbs.

title: David Balfour, etc.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: Thence we pushed to the Queensferry, where Rankeillor gave us a good welcome, being indeed out of the

title: David Balfour, etc.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: All day we kept moving, though often not much more ;and it was after dark ere we were up with the Queensferry.

title: David Balfour, etc.
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: I learned long afterwards that she haddespatched a horseman by daylight to Rankeillor atthe Queensferry, whom she knew to be the doer forShaws, and had then in her pocket a letter from thatgood friend of mine, presenting, in the most favourableview, my character and prospects.

title: Bloom of Faded Years. [A novel.]
author: Downe, Walmer.
snippet: To-morrow engage a carriage to St. Giles'—Cramond Bridge and the Valhalla of Scotland—touchingat the Parliament House and Advocates' Library; thendrive out to Queensferry, returning by way of Fettes'College.
